bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean and Cornelia Knox Kean, September 23, 1942 [Enclosed in KACA0090]

div1.p: Kellogg speaks of correspondence with Hench and is making arrangements for the design of the Gorgas Medal. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean and Cornelia Knox Kean, September 23, 1942 [Enclosed in KACA0090]
div1.opener:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
41 EAST 42ND STREET
NEW YORK, N.Y.
Sept. 23, '42
My dear General and Mrs Kean,
div1.p:
Enclosed find some photos,
I can't say too much for
any of them. The one of Mrs
Reed is particularly bad but
I think you will be interested
in seeing them anyway.

I had a letter from
Phil Hench yesterday. I'm
leaving next Sunday to see
him at Colorado Springs
(Camp Carson) where my younger
brother is also a Lt. Colonel, Chief
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
41 EAST 42ND STREET
NEW YORK, N.Y.
Surgeon for General Hospital # 50.
I hope he (my brother) is not
called out before I can get
there.

Col. Edgar E. Hume is
coming in to see me this
morning. John Wyeth and Bro.,
has agreed to sponsor the
Gorgas Medal and I have
suggested designs to show
Col. Hume on my desk.

We, Robin and I, enjoyed
our visit with you so much.
Please accept our kindest
regards.
